meta_description: The Heritage Center is a free public museum that is dedicated to the collection, preservation, and interpretation of Clark County’s history.
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

## **HERITAGE CENTER MUSEUM:**

_Tuesday – Friday_ : 9 AM to 4 PM  
 _Saturdays_ : 9 AM to 3 PM

#### **ADMISSION IS FREE!**

But donations are always welcome. Suggested Donations:

  * Adults – $5
  * Children – $2
  * Families – $10

## **LIBRARY & ARCHIVES:**

_Wednesday – Friday_ : 10 AM to 5 PM  
 _Saturdays_ : 10 AM to 3 PM

#### **BY APPOINTMENT ONLY!**

To schedule an appointment, please call (937) 324-0657 ext. 234 or e-mail [archives@heritagecenter.us](http://web.archive.org/web/20251008200115/mailto:archives@heritagecenter.us).

## **Parking**

Our large parking lot is accessible via South Fountain Avenue and South Center Street. 

## **Access & Entry**

The Heritage Center is ADA accessible, but please call (937) 324-0657 if you are in need of assistance.

#### MUSEUM

Entrance to the museum is situated in the middle of the building and is accessible from both north and south sides. 

#### LIBRARY & ARCHIVES

Entrance to our library & archives is accessible via the South Fountain entrance. Enter into the lobby through the exterior doors and head to the elevator that is on the right-hand side. Stop off at the 2nd floor to check in with our staff before proceeding to the library & archives on the 3rd floor.

## **Food & Drink**

[Un Mundo Café](http://web.archive.org/web/20251008200115/https://www.unmundocafe.com/) serves fresh roasts from [Deeper Roots Coffee](http://web.archive.org/web/20251008200115/http://www.deeperrootscoffee.com/), and many ...
